    • Method Detail

      • dispose

        public void dispose()

      • begin

        public void begin()
        Begins a new batching operation, without any hints specified. Content that is passed to the overloaded batch(...) method will be stored in a large, single buffer and drawn in a single GLES call when the end() method is invoked.

        Note that a flush may occur before end() is invoked in the case that the buffer is filled.

      • begin

        public void begin​(int hints)
        Begins a new batching operation, using the specified hints to potentially improve performance. Content that is passed to the overloaded batch(...) method will be stored in a large, single buffer and drawn in a single GLES call when the end() method is invoked.

        Note that a flush may occur before end() is invoked in the case that the buffer is filled.

        Parameters:
        hints - A bitwise-OR of the following hint flags:
        • #HINT_HARDWARE_TRANSFORMS
        • HINT_LINES
        • HINT_UNTEXTURED

      • end

        public void end()
        Signals that the current batching operation is completed and batched content should be drawn.

      • release

        public void release()

      • setMatrix

        public void setMatrix​(int mode,
                      float[] mx,
                      int offset)
        Sets the matrix for the specified mode
        Parameters:
        mode - One of:
        • GLES10.GL_PROJECTION
        • GLES10.GL_MODELVIEW
        • GLES10.GL_TEXTURE
        mx - The 4x4 matrix, column-major order
        offset - The offset into mx of the first element of the matrix

      • pushMatrix

        public void pushMatrix​(int mode)
        Pushes the specified matrix stack. The current matrix is saved and copied. The copy may be modified and subsequently returned to its previous state by invoking popMatrix(int).
        Parameters:
        mode - One of:
        • GLES10.GL_PROJECTION
        • GLES10.GL_MODELVIEW
        • GLES10.GL_TEXTURE

      • popMatrix

        public void popMatrix​(int mode)
        Pops the specified matrix stack. The current matrix is reset to the value of the matrix at the time of the last invocation of pushMatrix(int).
        Parameters:
        mode - One of:
        • GLES10.GL_PROJECTION
        • GLES10.GL_MODELVIEW
        • GLES10.GL_TEXTURE

      • setLineWidth

        public void setLineWidth​(float width)

      • batch

        public void batch​(int texId,
                  int mode,
                  int size,
                  int vStride,
                  java.nio.FloatBuffer vertices,
                  int tcStride,
                  java.nio.FloatBuffer texCoords,
                  float r,
                  float g,
                  float b,
                  float a)
        Adds the specified content to the current batch buffer.
        Parameters:
        texId - The texture ID, ignored if texCoords is null
        mode - The drawing mode for the vertices. Should be one of
        • GLES30.GL_LINES
        • GLES30.GL_LINE_STRIP
        • GLES30.GL_LINE_LOOP
        • GLES30.GL_TRIANGLES
        • GLES30.GL_TRIANGLE_STRIP
        • GLES30.GL_TRIANGLE_FAN
        size - The size of each vertex (number of components)
        vStride - The stride of each vertex, in bytes. If 0 the stride will be interpreted as the number of bytes per component times the number of components
        vertices - The buffer containing the vertices
        tcStride - The stride of each texture coordinate, in bytes. If 0, the stride will be interpreted as the number of bytes per component times 2. Ignored if texCoords is null.
        texCoords - The buffer containing the texture coordinates, or null if the geometry should not be textured
        r - Red color component, 0f to 1f
        g - Green color component, 0f to 1f
        b - Blue color component, 0f to 1f
        a - Alpha color component, 0f to 1f

      • batch

        public void batch​(int texId,
                  int mode,
                  int size,
                  int vStride,
                  java.nio.FloatBuffer vertices,
                  int tcStride,
                  java.nio.FloatBuffer texCoords,
                  java.nio.ShortBuffer indices,
                  float r,
                  float g,
                  float b,
                  float a)
        Adds the specified indexed content to the current batch buffer.
        Parameters:
        texId - The texture ID, ignored if texCoords is null
        mode - The drawing mode for the vertices. Should be one of
        • GLES30.GL_LINES
        • GLES30.GL_LINE_STRIP
        • GLES30.GL_LINE_LOOP
        • GLES30.GL_TRIANGLES
        • GLES30.GL_TRIANGLE_STRIP
        • GLES30.GL_TRIANGLE_FAN
        size - The size of each vertex (number of components)
        vStride - The stride of each vertex, in bytes. If 0 the stride will be interpreted as the number of bytes per component times the number of components
        vertices - The buffer containing the vertices
        tcStride - The stride of each texture coordinate, in bytes. If 0, the stride will be interpreted as the number of bytes per component times 2. Ignored if texCoords is null.
        texCoords - The buffer containing the texture coordinates, or null if the geometry should not be textured
        indices - The indices
        r - Red color component, 0f to 1f
        g - Green color component, 0f to 1f
        b - Blue color component, 0f to 1f
        a - Alpha color component, 0f to 1f
